Spacious and Modern (South End), 2BR, 3400, ID: 1081527Location: Massachusetts,  Boston (South End)Rent: $3400 / MonthBroker Fee: One MonthAvailable Date: NOWBeds: 2Baths: 2Pet: No PetFeatures: A/C,  Alcove,  Balcony,  Central Air,  Ceramic Tiles,  Deck,  Dining Room,  Dishwasher,  Disposal,  Eat-in Kitchen,  Fireplace (Decorative),  Granite Counter Tops,  Hardwood Floors,  High Ceiling,  Laundry in Unit,  Microwave,  Modern Bath,  Modern Kitchen,  New Appliances,  New/Renovated Bath,  New/Renovated Kitchen,  Parking For Rent,  Private Roof Deck,  Roof Deck,  Stainless Steel Appliance(s),  Storage,  Walk-In ClosetThis large two bedroom,  one bathroom apartment will be fully renovated with granite countertops,  stainless appliances and a double vanity,  and new tile bathroom. The apartment has a private washer and dryer,  central air conditioning and hardwood floors throughout unit. There is a large private roof deck in the rear which is dedicated solely to this apartment. A beautiful mature oak reaching up from the ground level provides a nice shade in the summer months. This historic preservation balances modern technology with historic preservation. The soaring twelve foot ceilings coupled with the two highly ornate mantles (non-functional),  the plaster crown molding and the flying scrolls provide an uncompromised traditional ambiance. This apartment is the epitome of modern living in a highly ornate historic preservation.Building constructed in 1865 as a single family home,  and has undergone a complete historic preservation conversion. The entire building has been retrofitted with a high efficiency heating system,  central air conditioning and instant hot water heaters. All the windows in the structure have been replaced with brand new custom,  historically accurate,  high efficiency windows. Efficient insulation has been installed to minimize the heat loss in the winter and heat gain in the summer.Located near the corner of Massachusetts Avenue and Washington Street,  the heart of 'restaurant row' in Boston's South End. The property is close to several transportation options and there are five Zip Car stations about ¼ mile away,  7 bus lines pass near the property,  and there are two Hub Way Bike stations nearby.The hospital is two blocks away. Downtown and several universities are in the direct vicinity. The building is also located less than ½ mile from the on ramp to I-93 allowing for easy access to regional commuting.Subway Lines and Stops:SILVER - Newton St. (0.37 miles)Bus Routes and Stops:47 - Albany St Opp E Newton St (0.1 miles)10 - 91 E Concord St (0.17 miles)CT3 - 91 E Concord St (0.17 miles)8 - 91 E Concord St (0.17 miles)CT1 - 88 E Newton St (0.18 miles)16 - South Bay Mall & Office Max (0.55 miles)Garvens Florusshow contact infoBoston Green Realty LLCprices,  conditions and rental terms are subject to change at any time.

description: 't miss it (Beacon Hill), 1BR, 1900, More About the Property.. This is a 1 bedroom apartment located in Beacon Hill. There is a kitchen that is ideal for use especially when traveling in a small group. The property is 750 Sq Feet and has 1 bedroom. It sleeps 2 and has 1 double/queen bed.AmenitiesComplimentary wifi available. The property is located in Beacon Hill. Bed linens an towels are included for your stay. The property has Internet and Cable TV. For your comfort,  the apartment has air-conditioning. This apartment is equipped with laundry facilities.More InformationThere is a 1000 USD security deposit that needs to be transferred to the host in cash. Please note that smoking is not allowed at this property,  so if you need,  please smoke only outdoors. Please note that the max number of guests allowed at the property is 2.About the NeighborhoodHolding a proud reputation as the richest area of Boston,  Beacon Hill is a largely residential neighborhood. Home to graceful brownstone houses (now the city's most exclusive residences) and the gold-domed Massachusetts State House,  this wealthy enclave also houses U.S. senators,  businessmen and their families. A visit to the Nichols House Museum here offers a glimpse of life back in the 19th and early 20th century. The 1804 townhouse still maintains in its possession its original fittings,  furnishings and art. Stroll along Charles Street for delightful vintage shopping or a sumptuous lunch in one of the many charming restaurants here (locals love the Paramount located on 44 Charles Street). Step back into history and walk the Black Heritage Trail to explore the city's historic sites like the 1806 African Meeting House,  the 54th Regiment Memorial and pre-Civil War structures. As one of Boston's oldest communities,  Beacon Hill is a page out of American history. While it retains its past beautifully with red-brick houses,  cobblestone streets and antique stores,  this neighborhood lives very well in the present. Its streets are bike and stroller-friendly (a bonus for young families in the area). Green spaces like the Boston Common offer Beacon Hill residents a chance to relax,  play and enjoy the outdoors. The combination of Beacon Hill's historical past and its lively,  charming present makes it one of the most attractive neighborhoods in Boston.

description: / 1br - $795 Unfurnished Bedroom for Female: March-August 2016 (Coolidge Corne, 1BR, 795, We are looking for a mid-late 20s female to rent out a room in our 3-bedroom apartment. The room is unfurnished and the apartment is a 5-minutes walk from Coolidge Corner. The lease will be for SIX MONTHS: March 1,  2016 -- August 31,  2016. It may be possible to renew the lease for the September 2016 lease year,  though this is not guaranteed. We are looking for someone who is clean,  quiet,  respectful,  and appropriately laid back (i.e.,  no 420/other drugs,  no smokers,  and no hardcore partiers) and who would enjoy joining in on TV/movie nights in the living room and the occasional adult beverage on the terrace (i.e.,  deck overlooking the lovely parking lot out back). ☺The ideal roommate is in her late-twenties and either a young professional or graduate student. Undergrads will not be considered (no exceptions,  our landlord does not lease to undergrads).About the apartment: Overall,  the place is very large; we have a living room,  dining room,  eat-in kitchen,  bathroom,  3 bedrooms (with closets),  3 shared storage closets,  and a balcony. Laundry is coin-op in the basement. We get great light in the place most of the day,  so it's super cheerful! The common areas of the apartment are fully furnished. The two roommates staying have been here for between 1 - 4 years.Rent will be $795 per person plus utilities -- heat,  hot water,  electric,  cable/internet -- which range from roughly $60-$130 depending upon the time of year. We tend to keep the heat low in the winter and roommates can choose to pay a little more for electric in the summer months if they wish to use a window unit air conditioner in their bedrooms.The apartment is located within a short walk of the Coolidge Corner and St. Paul Street T stops on the C line,  as well as several B line stops. There is no overnight street parking in Brookline,  so if you have a car you'll have to rent a private space nearby. The neighborhood is generally quiet and safe,  filled with young professionals,  grad students,  and families.Interested? Great! Send us an e-mail with some info about yourself and any questions you might have. We're looking to schedule viewings during February.

description: southie condo! Utilities incl (South Boston), 2BR, 1500, One bedroom available for rent in beautiful South Boston home. Looking for a roommate who is a professional (no college students please),  no pets,  no smoking.Willing to connect on social media,  meet for coffee or a drink to see if the fit is right! Very flexible with move in date.

description: (46 Hanson Street,  Somerville), 4BR, 900, We have a room opening up in our 4 bedroom / 2 bathroom apartment from about March 12 - all of May and perhaps the first week or two of June. We can be flexible on dates - if you'd like to move in March 1st that would be fine. There is also a slight chance the room will be available until about September 12th.The apartment includes a washer and dryer in the unit (not coin operated). The kitchen has a dishwasher,  oven,  gas range stove,  and a microwave. There is a living room with a futon as well. Both bathrooms have showers. The apartment is on the 2nd and 3rd floor of a building in Somerville,  about a 15 minute walk from the Harvard T stop,  a 10 minute walk from Inman Square,  and about a 20 minute walk from the Porter T stop. It's a short walk from numerous bars and restaurants and three different grocery stores. The spacious bedroom with a queen-sized bed has an east facing window that lets in lots of sun during the day,  but is not exposed to any streetlights at night. There is storage space available in the basement as well as in crawlspaces off the bedroom.Rent is $900/month plus utilities. Water,  gas,  and wifi tend to be about $30/month/person in the summer,  and a bit more during colder months. There is a parking space on a private dead-end street just outside the apartment available for $20/month. The owner wants to run the normal background check on a subletter and there may be a nominal fee for this. We would expect first and last month's rent upon commitment to move in.About us - three friendly,  clean,  and outgoing young men,  two are in grad school at Harvard,  one is a consultant. The consultant travels most of the week most weeks for work,  so there would normally only be two other people in the apartment. We like to socialize,  but tend to be fairly busy with work and studying during the week.

description: ), 3BR, 1250, Dear Internet, My roommates and I have an amazing newly refurbished 3 bedroom/2 bath apartment townhouse floor on East Broadway in Southie. Sadly,  I am relocating for work beginning in April and we're looking for someone to take over one of the rooms. The apartment is 1, 110 sq feet and the open room is roughly 10 ft x 12 ft with a huge closet,  great natural light,  and fantastic proximity to my two roommates. For those of you who like clean clothes--we also have our washer and dryer in unit.We all work in some variety of finance with some longer hours but the home vibe is pretty mellow. Weekends are usually spent road-tripping up to Vermont or New Hampshire for some variety of skiing or hangout time and weekdays we try to get some couch chilling in. It's important to note that each week there is at least a 50% chance you will find yourself watching a forgotten Will Farrell movie on the 60 inch surround sound system. It's relatively unavoidable.Extra perks include our super sweet gas fire place which is perfect for when winter decides to stretch through May/June. Similarly important is our equally sweet private porch for when winter finally goes away. Going one direction,  we're less than a 1 minute walk from the beach and a 10 minute walk from Castle Island. If you head the other way,  in about 10 mins you can find yourself at Stats or Lincoln. Public transit is also great and we're one of the first stops on the 7,  9,  10,  and 11 busses which can drop you anywhere downtown in about 10 minutes door to door. If you like any combination of cozy couches,  waterfront proximity,  sweet bars,  easy transit,  and nice guys,  we'd love to meet you.

The patio area is perfect for outdoor entertaining and is landscaped with patio pavers and has a beautiful mature oak provide a nice shade in the summer months. The property is at the heart of multiple transportation options. description: . 31st, 3BR, 830, My room - in a 3-bedroom apartment - is available for rent in PORTER SQUARE from June 1st to Aug 31st (with possibility of renewal next year as I am moving out of Boston).The apartment is in a quiet neighborhood right across from Porter Square (Red Line access,  grocery shopping (Star Market),  CVS,  Walgreens,  Dunkin Donuts,  Porter Square Books,  Panera,  and a bunch of bars & restaurants,  including one of my favorite : Christopher's)YOUR ROOM: Bright and sunny with enormous windows and a large closet. The room will be fully furnished and fits a full bed,  nightstand,  dresser,  study table and chair,  and a bookcase with plenty of space for additional pieces.THE APARTMENT:- Utilities (electric & heat) plus internet is about $40 in the summer per roommate- 1 bathroom- Large,  eat-in kitchen with dishwasher- Coin-op laundry in basement- The apartment is heated with vents and is controlled by a thermostat- Hardwood floors throughout- Easy access to the Red line and 77,  83,  87,  and 96 bus lines- No smoking or drugsAbout your future roommates:- One roommate is a female,  twenty-something public accountant,  but despite the desk job,  loves spending time outside exploring the city,  playing soccer,  and pretending to know about wine. In the summer,  free time is mostly spent at the beach.- The other roommate is a 26 y/o girl who loves craft beer (specifically Ommegang),  the Bills,  and Ireland. Still exploring Boston,  and loves to try new places in other neighborhoods. Excited to meet someone who likes to hang out and have fun around the town,  or chill in the apartment with a beverage and a good movie.About you:23 years+ Graduate student or professional with a steady income and a sense of humor. Keeps common spaces clean and pays bills on time. Both my roommates are very friendly and we hang out together pretty often but also respect each other's privacy.Please reply via e-mail so we can talk further. Give us a brief description (job,  hobbies,  ideal living environment...) so we can know more about you :)I hope to hear from you soon!Nina

description: 1 Bedroom apt July 1st (South End), 1BR, 3354, I am subletting my 1 bedroom 720 square foot apartment starting July 1,  2016. I am happy to allow you to move in a few days early. My wife and I are moving due to medical residency and have 1 extra month on our lease. The apartment lease can be extended for as long as you want. You can discuss with the building owner prior to committing to sublet.About the building: in the Ink Block building. Building is above the brand new Whole Foods with direct elevator access to the grocery store. The doorman building has an rooftop outdoor pool,  grills,  outdoor TV,  and outdoor green space. Perfect for entertaining. The building also has multiple indoor spaces to host parties,  study,  watch tv,  etc. all free to use or free to reserve. There is a state of the art gym and fitness studio also free to residents. There is glassed in underground bike storage free for use. Parking is available but costs extra.About the Apartment: the apartment is roughly 720 square feet,  brand new,  we are the first tenants and have only lived here for 1 year. 1 bedroom,  floor to ceiling windows,  Central AC,  in unit washer and dryer,  wood floors,  mable counters,  stainless steel appliances. Great walk in closet tons of space,  also large coat closet in main area. The bathroom is huge and modern and can be accessed from bedroom or living room.The rent is $3354. This includes most everything. There is a water bill and electric bill which has roughly come to $50 per month total.See pictures,  it is truly an amazing apartment and building. 5th floor,  great backbay views. We will be sad to leave. Please email me with questions or if you would like a tour.As I said,  you would be taking over the last month of our lease and can extend the lease as long or short as you would like. No fees. Great for medical residents or employees of Tufts or BMC because of location. But also great overall location in the south end of boston.-Dave

The kitchen has all the essentials needed to cook at home when you just want to stay in for the night,  along with stainless steel appliances. Additionally,  you will have laundry machines within the unit as well. The apartment has high ceilings,  and has a very good amount of space for you and your family. Wifi is included..

description: . near Davis Square, 1BR, 1000, Hello fellow craigslister!I'm offering up my sunny room near Davis Square,  which will be unoccupied from May 18th - July 5th. If you will be available during the majority,  but not all of that time (and you're interested),  still reach out. Start and end dates might be flexible.About the room:The room itself gets wonderful sunlight. Decorated with art I've been gifted,  personally made,  and acquired throughout the years. It has a queen-sized bed and huge desk for all working/studying needs. There is a chest of drawers and a closet with hangers (large enough to stand/lie down in) that will all be available to you. The rent includes internet+utilities. There is a garage-overhang,  off-street parking spot available. It would cost a bit more as I would have to find a storage location for my vehicle.About the apartment and roomies:The apartment is a 3 bed/2 bath. It's on the 3rd floor of a building with an elevator and wide hallways. The bathroom is shared with one other roommate and the kitchen and living room are shared amongst all 3 roommates. Your roommates will be two awesome women. One roommate is an elementary school teacher and the other a recent grad who works multiple jobs. Both are incredibly friendly and wonderfully considerate. The apartment has centralized A/C and coin-operated laundry machines in the building. Both the room and the apartment are smoke-free (not 4/20 friendly indoors).The apartment is a 10 minute walk down the Somerville Community Bike Path to the lively Davis Square. The bike path is occupied with people walking their dogs,  parents with their children,  and all-around happy humans. It's a large part of what sold me on the apartment/neighborhood. The apartment's also a 10-12 minute walk from Porter Square.You:Can be male or female. The space is incredibly accepting and welcoming,  and I hope that you are same. You should be considerate,  clean,  and conscientious. If you respect and treat the space like it is your own,  there shouldn't be a problem. =DI'm available for apartment viewings on weekends on some weeknights. Message if you have any questions or would like to set up a viewing!

(Jamaica Plain), 1BR, 865, I'm a Brazilian PhD student and my time here is almost over,  so we are looking for someone to stay in my place for the very nice apartment we are living. You would have 2 roommates (a lovely young lady and a great guy) that are very chill out and awesome. We also have an extra guest,  a cat!The room can comfortably fit a full size bed and dresser. It would help me a lot if you prefer just to buy my furniture (a full size bed + mattress + desser - the price is negotiable). It comes with a closet,  also. There is a window and you will have you own personal porch.The apartment is great and is located in a very calm street on the 3rd floor. It's a 3 bedroom/1 bathroom apartment,  recently renovated and comes with everything you would need,  except the furniture in your room. The kitchen is pretty big and you are more than welcome try your Top Chef abilities. Also,  we have a porch and a huge living room. Hardwood floors throughout the apartment,  except for the kitchen and bathroom are tile. It has heat and each room has it's own unit so it's easy to heat up the space. There is a washer and a coin-operated dryer in the basement.It's close to Washignton st.,  where you can find a Walgreens,  many small markets,  bakeries and other kinds of stores. It is located at Stony Brook,  just 1 station away from Jackson Square,  where you can find supermarkets (Stop & Shop and Whole Foods) and lots of restaurants and pubs. If you love beer,  it's very close to Samuel Adams brewery.Street parking throughout the neighborhood. The room will be available from 4/16/2016 with the possibility of signing a new lease after the 31st if interested.Available: April 16th-August 31stRent: $865/monthUtilities: usually run $30-50 per person depending on the seasonPlease feel free to contact me via email or text to set up a time to see the room.Rafaela

description: ), 1BR, 733, One furnished bedroom in a 3 bedroom apartment is available May 9 for sublease,  ending Aug. 31. Rent is only $733 each plus utilities. Free Washer and dryer in the basement. Utilities while we've been here have been ~$90 each in the summer. I am a current grad student who has secured a job in the Midwest for the summer.Bedroom is furnished with a Queen Bed,  Dresser,  Small Bookcase,  Side Tables,  and desk.Your roommates:We're two women,  36 and 30. We have our own friends but enjoy hanging out together. We both like beer but our partying days are pretty much done,  I'm much more into having friends over to watch the Bs or something and grilling out.We are looking for a one person,  F or M,  somewhere in their late twenties-early thirties as well. Working professional with normal work schedule preferred,  but if you can make your rent every month we're happy. NO drugs. NO Pets.We like to keep common areas neat,  but don't care what your bedroom looks like. Occasional overnight guests are fine,  but we're not looking for a 'three pay,  four live' situation. We enjoy each others' company and occasionally get in over our heads together making adventurous Sunday dinners.Plentiful on-street parking house has a fenced backyard,  front and back porches,  tons of windows for lots of light and good airflow.Walking distance to several bus lines into the city.Message us if you're interested!
